title: Day 733
content:
# Day 733

This weekend, I visited my grandparents who live north of Atlanta. The drive each way takes about six hours, and it's mind-boggling that during both trips, I could listen to people I enjoy the entire time. I don't personally know any of these individuals, but technology magically allows me to do so.

With new technologies emerging at an increasingly rapid pace, it can be overwhelming to keep up. The rate at which innovations are being introduced is enough to make one's head spin. However, it excites me. Imagine trying to explain a podcast to Julius Caesar. It would take a long time. Which isn't to say we can't learn from a mind like Caesars. As a matter of fact there is a great deal we can't learn from the past.

<iframe src="https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?type=text%2Fhtml&key=a19fcc184b9711e1b4764040d3dc5c07&schema=twitter&url=https%3A//twitter.com/ConorChepenik/status/1771877930169163920%3Fs%3D20&image=" title="" height="281" width="500"></iframe>

In the face of relentless technological evolution, maintaining humility is crucial. It's vital to recognize that the future, unpredictable and laden with possibilities, will undoubtedly be astonishing. We must remain humble, continuously pursue knowledge, and relentlessly seek truth. In an era where artificial intelligence amplifies the significance of face-to-face interactions, these principles gain even greater importance, shaping a future where genuine human connection holds unparalleled value.

3/24/24

Conor Jay Chepenik
